summary:
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on South Sudan, reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity.

Welcomes the signing of the Agreement on the Resolution of the Conflict in South Sudan and calls for its full implementation, including timelines.

Expresses concern over continued fighting, delays in implementing the agreement, and urges parties to adhere to the permanent ceasefire.

Commends the efforts of IGAD-Plus and urges enhanced support from the international community.

Welcomes the appointment of Festus Mogae as Chair of the Joint Monitoring and Evaluation Commission (JMEC) and urges full engagement with JMEC.

Recognizes the important role of civil society, faith leaders, women, and youth in South Sudan.

Reaffirms the basic principles of peacekeeping and reiterates its grave alarm and concern regarding the crisis in South Sudan.

Recognizes the need for stable security arrangements in Juba and encourages reconciliation and building a democratic state.

Takes note of reports on human rights situations, welcomes the release of the AU Commission of Inquiry report, and emphasizes its hope for consideration by transitional justice and reconciliation mechanisms.
